edu.biu.scapi.circuits.fastGarbledCircuit

Class FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.circuits.fastGarbledCircuit.FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FastGarbledBooleanCircuit, FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended

    public class FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp
extends java.lang.Object
implements FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
    This class is an implementation of the fast extended garbled boolean circuit.

    The extensions implemented in this class are: 1. The ability to set the input or/and output garbled values. 2. The ability to sample the garbled values using a given seed.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp

        public FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp(FastGarbledBooleanCircuit gbc,
                                    MultiKeyEncryptionScheme mes)
        This constructor should be used in case the garbling is done using a MultiKeyEncryptionScheme.

        It gets the inner garbled boolean circuit and the encryption scheme.

        Parameters:
        gbc - The inner garbled boolean circuit to wrap.
        mes - The MultiKeyEncryptionScheme to use during garbling.

      • FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp

        public FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtendedImp(FastGarbledBooleanCircuit gbc,
                                    MultiKeyEncryptionScheme mes,
                                    PseudorandomGenerator prg)
        This constructor should be used in case the garbling is done using a PRG and seed.

        It gets the inner garbled boolean circuit, the encryption scheme and the PRG.

        Parameters:
        gbc - The inner GarbledBooleanCircuit to wrap.
        mes - The MultiKeyEncryptionScheme to use during garbling.
        prg - The PseudorandomGenerator to use during the garbling process.

    • Method Detail

      • setInputKeys

        public void setInputKeys(byte[] inputValues)
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Gets the input keys, which are the input garbled values and sets them. This way when calling the garble function the input values will not be sampled but taken from the given values.
        Specified by:
        setInputKeys in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Parameters:
        inputValues - contains both garbled values for each input wire. The input values are placed one after another, meaning that the input values are in the following format: [k0,0 k0,1 k1,0 k1,1 k2,0 k2,1 ....] (while k0,1 is key 1 of wire 0).

      • setOutputKeys

        public void setOutputKeys(byte[] outputValues)
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Gets the output keys, which are the output garbled values and sets them. This way when calling the garble function the output values will not be sampled but taken from the given values.
        Specified by:
        setOutputKeys in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Parameters:
        outputValues - contains both garbled values for each output wire. The output values are placed one after another, meaning that the output values are in the following format: [k0,0 k0,1 k1,0 k1,1 k2,0 k2,1 ....] (while k0,1 is key 1 of wire 0).

      • garble

        public FastCircuitCreationValues garble()
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        This method generates both keys for each wire. Then, creates the garbled table according to those values.

        Specified by:
        garble in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Returns:
        FastCircuitCreationValues contains both keys for each input and output wire and the translation table.

      • garble

        public FastCircuitCreationValues garble(byte[] seed)
                                 throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        This method generates both keys for each input wire using the seed. It then creates the garbled table according to those values.

        Specified by:
        garble in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        seed - Used to initialize the prg.
        Returns:
        FastCircuitCreationValues Contains both keys for each input and output wire and the translation table.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - In case the seed is an invalid key for the given PRG.

      • getGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput

        public byte[] getGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput(byte[] ungarbledInputBits,
                                       byte[] allInputWireValues,
                                       int partyNumber)
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        This method takes an array containing the non garbled values, both keys for all input wires and the party number which the inputs belong to.

        This method then performs the lookup on the allInputWireValues according to the party number and returns the keys of the corresponding input bits.

        Specified by:
        getGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        ungarbledInputBits - An array containing the non garbled value for each input wire of the given party number.
        allInputWireValues - The array containing both garbled values (keys) for each input wire. The input values are placed one after another, meaning that the input values are in the following format: [k0,0 k0,1 k1,0 k1,1 k2,0 k2,1 ....] (while k0,1 is key 1 of wire 0).
        partyNumber - The number of party which the inputs belong to.
        Returns:
        an array containing a single key of each input wire of the given party.

      • compute

        public byte[] compute()
               throws NotAllInputsSetException
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        This method computes the circuit using the given inputs.

        It returns an array containing the garbled output. This output can be translated via the #translate() method.

        Specified by:
        compute in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Returns:
        returns an array containing the garbled value of each output wire.
        Throws:
        NotAllInputsSetException - if the given inputs array does not includes a key for all input wires.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] allInputWireValues)
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries.

        Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them (of his choice) to confirm that they are indeed garbling of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both keys for each of the input wires.

        Specified by:
        verify in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        allInputWireValues - An array containing both keys for each input wire. The input values are placed one after another, meaning that the input values are in the following format: [k0,0 k0,1 k1,0 k1,1 k2,0 k2,1 ....] (while k0,1 is key 1 of wire 0).
        Returns:
        true if this GarbledBooleanCircuit is a garbling the given keys, false if it is not.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] allInputWireValues,
             byte[] allOutputWireValues)
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries.

        Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them (of his choice) to confirm that they are indeed garbling of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both keys for each of the input wires.

        This verify function is the same as the verify(Map allInputWireValues) but also check that the resulted output garbled values are equal to the given allOutputWireValues.

        Specified by:
        verify in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Parameters:
        allInputWireValues - contains both garbled values for each input wire. The input values are placed one after another, meaning that the input values are in the following format: [k0,0 k0,1 k1,0 k1,1 k2,0 k2,1 ....] (while k0,1 is key 1 of wire 0).
        allOutputWireValues - contains both garbled values for each input wire. As in the inputs, the output values are placed one after another. The generated output garbled values are checked against these values to see if they are equal. For each output wire index, the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
        Returns:
        true if this GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended is a garbling the given keys, false if it is not.

      • internalVerify

        public boolean internalVerify(byte[] allInputWireValues,
                     byte[] allOutputWireValues)
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        This function behaves exactly as the verify(byte[] allInputWireValues) method except the last part. The verify function verifies that the translation table matches the resulted output garbled values, while this function does not check it but return the resulted output garbled values.
        Specified by:
        internalVerify in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        allInputWireValues - An array containing both keys for each input wire. The input values are placed one after another, meaning that the input values are in the following format: [k0,0 k0,1 k1,0 k1,1 k2,0 k2,1 ....] (while k0,1 is key 1 of wire 0).
        allOutputWireValues - An array containing both keys for each output wire. The output values are placed one after another, meaning that the output values are in the following format: [k0,0 k0,1 k1,0 k1,1 k2,0 k2,1 ....] (while k0,1 is key 1 of wire 0). When calling the function this array should be empty and will be filled during the process of the function.
        Returns:
        true if this GarbledBooleanCircuit is a garbling the given keys, false if it is not.

        public boolean verifyTranslationTable(byte[] keys)
        Check that the output wires translate correctly.
        Specified by:
        verifyTranslationTable in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        internalOutputs -
        Returns:

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] seed,
             byte[] allInputGarbledValues,
             byte[] allOutputGarbledValues,
             CryptographicHash hash,
             byte[] hashedCircuit)
               throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries.

        Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them (of his choice) to confirm that they are indeed garbling of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both keys for each of the input wires.

        This verify function samples the keys using the given seed, then compute the hash function on the circuit's garbled tables and translation table and check that the result is equal to the given hashedCircuit.

        Specified by:
        verify in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Parameters:
        seed - to use in order to generate the keys.
        allInputGarbledValues - contains both garbled values for each input wire. The input values are placed one after another, meaning that the input values are in the following format: [k0,0 k0,1 k1,0 k1,1 k2,0 k2,1 ....] (while k0,1 is key 1 of wire 0). Should be null in case the user set no input garbled values before garbling.
        allOutputGarbledValues - contains both garbled values for each input wire. The input values are placed one after another. Should be null in case the user set no output garbled values before garbling.
        hash - CryptographicHash object to use.
        hashedCircuit - A byte array that suppose to be the result of the hash function on the circuit.
        Returns:
        true if this GarbledBooleanCircuitExtended is a garbling the given seed, false if it is not.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException

        Specified by:
        verifyHashedCircuit in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuitExtended
        Parameters:
        hash - CryptographicHash function object to use.
        hashedCircuit - A byte array that suppose to be the result of the hash function on the circuit.
        Returns:
        true if the given hashedCircuit is indeed the result of the hash function of the circuit; False, otherwise.

      • getGarbledTables

        public GarbledTablesHolder getGarbledTables()
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        The garbled tables are stored in the circuit for all the gates. This method returns the garbled tables.

        This function is useful if we would like to pass many garbled circuits built on the same boolean circuit.

        This is a compact way to define a circuit, that is, two garbled circuit with the same multi encryption scheme and the same basic boolean circuit only differ in the garbled tables and the translation table.

        Thus we can hold one garbled circuit for all the circuits and only replace the garbled tables (and the translation tables if necessary). The advantage is that the size of the tables only is much smaller that all the information stored in the circuit (gates and other member variables). The size becomes important when sending large circuits.

        Specified by:
        getGarbledTables in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit

      • setGarbledTables

        public void setGarbledTables(GarbledTablesHolder garbledTables)
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Sets the garbled tables of this circuit.

        This function is useful if we would like to pass many garbled circuits built on the same boolean circuit.

        This is a compact way to define a circuit, that is, two garbled circuit with the same multi encryption scheme and the same basic boolean circuit only differ in the garbled tables and the translation table.

        Thus we can hold one garbled circuit for all the circuits and only replace the garbled tables (and the translation tables if necessary). The advantage is that the size of the tables only is much smaller that all the information stored in the circuit (gates and other member variables). The size becomes important when sending large circuits.

        The receiver of the circuits will set the garbled tables for the relevant circuit.

        Specified by:
        setGarbledTables in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit

      • verifiedTranslate

        public byte[] verifiedTranslate(byte[] garbledOutput,
                       byte[] allOutputWireValues)
                         throws CheatAttemptException
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Verifies that the given garbledOutput is valid values according to the given all OutputWireValues.

        Meaning, for each output wire, checks that the garbled wire is one of the two possibilities. Then, translates the garbled output obtained from the FastGarbledBooleanCircuit.compute() function into a meaningful(i.e. 0-1) output.

        Specified by:
        verifiedTranslate in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        garbledOutput - An array contains the garbled output.
        allOutputWireValues - both values for each output wire. The output values are placed one after another, meaning that the output values are in the following format: [k0,0 k0,1 k1,0 k1,1 k2,0 k2,1 ....] (while k0,1 is key 1 of wire 0).
        Returns:
        an array contains the output bit for each output wire.
        Throws:
        CheatAttemptException - if there is a garbledOutput values that is not one of the two possibilities.

      • getTranslationTable

        public byte[] getTranslationTable()
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Returns the translation table of the circuit.

        This is necessary since the constructor of the circuit may want to pass the translation table to an other party.

        Usually, this will be used when the other party (not the constructor of the circuit) creates a circuit, sets the garbled tables and needs the translation table as well to complete the construction of the circuit.

        Specified by:
        getTranslationTable in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Returns:
        the translation table of the circuit.

      • setTranslationTable

        public void setTranslationTable(byte[] translationTable)
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Sets the translation table of the circuit.

        This is necessary when the garbled tables where set and we would like to compute the circuit later on.

        Specified by:
        setTranslationTable in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        translationTable - This value should match the garbled tables of the circuit.
